channel.title: BBC News - Scotland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Dawson's delight as she wins Olympic swimming gold
item.description: Kathleen Dawson becomes the first Scottish woman in nearly 70 years to win an Olympic medal in the pool.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Digital vaccine certificates to replace paper versions
item.description: A Â£600,000 contract has been awarded by the Scottish government to replace the paper Covid vaccination certificates.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Cardinal Keith O'Brien: Abuse accuser says lessons not learned
item.description: Former priest Brian Devlin has waived his anonymity to write a book on the scandal that rocked the Catholic Church in 2013.

item.title: Three men in hospital after crashed car catches fire near Peterculter
item.description: An 18-year-old man suffered "life-changing injuries" in the smash on the A93 outside Peterculter.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gold for Kathleen Dawson in mixed relay
item.description: Kathleen Dawson recovers from starting slip as Great Britain win mixed relay gold, as Jemma Reekie eases through to the 800m final.

item.title: Cyclist in critical condition after crash with car near Aviemore
item.description: The 18-year-old was riding on the A95 near Aviemore when he was involved in a collision with a red Peugeot 307.

item.title: 'Wilful' house fire in Glasgow being probed by police
item.description: The blaze in Glasgow city centre, which saw residents evacuated but nobody injured, is under investigation.

item.title: Scotland's seventh drowning victim in a week dies in hospital
item.description: Aman Sharma, 34, was pulled from Loch Lubnaig on Sunday afternoon but never regained consciousness.

item.title: Flexibility allows Edinburgh Art Festival to flourish
item.description: BBC Scotland's Pauline McLean finds "much to admire" as the capital's summer events start to return.

item.title: Drug deaths in Scotland reach new record level
item.description: The country continues to have the worst drug death rate in Europe, with a further 1,339 people dying last year.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules at level zero?
item.description: The whole of Scotland has now moved to level zero, but what does that actually mean people can do?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Do I need a vaccine certificate to travel?
item.description: The documents could be used in an international vaccine passport programme enabling foreign travel.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Six ways to tackle Scotland's drugs crisis
item.description: What can be done to try to halt Scotland's rising toll of drug-related deaths?

item.title: The seaweed farmers with high hopes for their harvest
item.description: Kelp grown off the coast of the Isle of Skye could be used in food, packaging and cosmetic products.

item.title: Disease killing 'Europe's oldest' elm tree
item.description: Believed to almost 800 years old, the Beauly elm has been laser-scanned as part of work to document it.

item.title: 'Most powerful' tidal turbine starts generating electricity off Orkney
item.description: The Orbital O2, which is anchored off Orkney, has the capacity to meet the annual power demand of 2,000 homes.

item.title: 'Luxury' race will be among most expensive on earth
item.description: A four-day ultramarathon covering 120 miles on the west coast of Scotland will cost Â£15,499 to enter.

item.title: Scottish boy plucked from obscurity stars in Indian film Mimi on Netflix
item.description: Three-year-old Jacob Smith of Aberdeen was plucked from obscurity on holiday and cast with Kriti Sanon in Mimi.

item.title: Scottish drug deaths: 'We need more drug users in treatment'
item.description: The drug minister says the level of deaths in Scotland is a "national disgrace" and has pledged to get more people into treatment.

item.title: High hopes for Scottish farmed seaweed
item.description: Kelp grown off the coast of the Isle of Skye could be used in food, packaging and cosmetic products.

item.title: The Scottish mice helping to rewild Ealing
item.description: Tiny harvest mice are being exported from East Kilbride to Ealing to help with a rewilding project.

item.title: Glasgow rapper Oakzy B wants to be 'bigger than Burns'
item.description: Oakzy B is one of the contenders battling it out for a Â£50,000 prize in BBC Three's The Rap Game.

item.title: Man who lost wife and son in loch thought water 'looked safe'
item.description: A man who lost his wife and son in a drowning incident at Loch Lomond said the water had looked safe.

item.title: Watch: Sportscene - Scottish Premiership opening day highlights
item.description: Michael Stewart and Neil McCann join Jonathan Sutherland on Sportscene for highlights of the opening day of the Scottish Premiership season.

item.title: Hearts 2-1 Celtic: John Souttar header claims win for Robbie Neilson's side
item.description: Celtic suffer opening-day defeat for the first time in 24 years - and Ange Postecoglou's chastening start as manager continued - as Hearts made a winning Scottish Premiership return.

item.title: South Africa 27-9 British and Irish Lions: Springboks level series in fiery encounter
item.description: The British and Irish Lions' series with South Africa will go to a decider after the Springboks win a fiery second Test 27-9 at Cape Town Stadium.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win 4x100m mixed medley relay gold
item.description: Great Britain secure a fourth swimming gold at an Olympics for the first time in 113 years by winning the inaugural 4x100m mixed medley relay in a world-record time.

item.title: Rangers 3-0 Livingston: Champions start with win
item.description: Rangers manager Steven Gerrard has backed "outstanding" Scott Wright to step in should Ianis Hagi fail to recover from injury for Tuesday's Champions League qualifier in Malmo.
